item.description: This message was not just for others. It was for me too.

item.title: Mirror
item.description:
they fear me
because I make them
see

not who I say they are—
but who stares back
when no one's watching

they flinch
at the cracks
they thought were
buried deep

I don't choose this
I don't perform
but even that—
they call an act

I say I’m real.
but what if...
this self was slowly sculpted
by every glance
I caught in glass?

still,
in this half-sleeping world,
someone
has to stay
awake

they call it cruelty
but I know:
the mirror doesn't lie
it just doesn't look away

and truth—
truth stings
before it soothes

item.title: Expresso
item.description:
You came for truth — don’t complain it’s bitter. Sip slowly, or choke.

I’m no dessert — I’m the wake-up call. If I were gentle, you’d still be asleep.

One sip, and you remember what you’re capable of. I don’t fix — I reveal.

You don’t need motivation, you need a mirror. You’re not lost — just pretending.

Progress stings — that’s waking up.

Comfort zones? Coffins with better light.

Burnout? Your soul escaping mediocrity.

Waiting? Spoiler: it’s late.

You don’t need more time — just less fear. If it scares you, it’s right.

Don’t call it chaos — call it momentum. Take the shot — or sip excuses.

Move. Get up. Or get out of the way.

Rest later. There’s work — and you know it.

Addicted? Good. It’s working. Thank me later.

item.title: Vapour (Almost)
item.description:
You’re in this cup.
Not by name, but by intention.

We shared tea.
That’s closer than names.

I made this for a rainy day.
Then you arrived.

You left your warmth in my favorite mug.
I haven’t touched it since.

We could sit closer…
but it might unbalance the tea.

I don’t stay.
Not because I don’t want to—
but because I steep too deep,
and warmth can scald.

I’ve known teas that change when you turn away.
People too.

Clarity is overrated.
Some flavors are better left undefined.

This cup holds what I didn’t say.
Sip carefully.

What do I feel for you?
Mmm… like tea left too long—
strong, a little bitter, impossible to ignore.

Ask me again when the steam has faded.
I might speak more clearly then.

item.title: Clouds (Maybe)
item.description:
It might rain… or not.
But I feel like we’ll get wet either way.
The wind kind of said it…
or maybe it didn’t… something like that.

The sky feels like it’s smiling…
in a scary way, or maybe a kind one…
Maybe the end is just something
that happens halfway through a beginning.

It might be soon… or it might never come…
but you feel it too, right?
It’s like everything’s decided…
and also totally not… that kind of path, you know?

Whether it was a dream or real…
even when you open your eyes, it’s hard to tell.
I can remember yesterday,
but I’m not sure if it’s the same yesterday.

Was I really me?
Or maybe I was just part of someone else’s dream…
Whether I like them or not…
hmm, if just watching is enough, then maybe…

I’m glad we met. Maybe…
I feel like we’ve already met, long ago...
Don’t you think…
if we don’t say goodbye, we might come back?
